content.p: All persons of the age of 18 years who are under no legal disability, and all persons who have been declared emancipated pursuant toNRS 129.080to129.140, inclusive, are capable of entering into any contract, and are, to all intents and purposes, held and considered to be of lawful age.

section.heading: Disability of minority removed in connection with any transaction entered into pursuant to Servicemenï¿½s Readjustment Act of 1944.

content.p: The disability of minority of any person otherwise eligible for guaranty or insurance of a loan pursuant to the Servicemenï¿½s Readjustment Act of 1944, as amended (38 U.S.C. ï¿½ï¿½ 3701 et seq.), and of the minor spouse of any eligible veteran, irrespective of his or her age, in connection with any transaction entered into pursuant to that Act, as amended, is hereby removed for all purposes in connection with such transactions, including, but not limited to, incurring of indebtedness or obligations, acquiring, encumbering, selling, releasing or conveying property or any interest therein, and litigating or settling controversies arising therefrom, if all or part of any obligations incident to such transaction are guaranteed or insured by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs pursuant to such Act. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
This section must not be construed to impose any other or greater rights or liabilities than would exist if such person and such spouse were under no such disability.

section.heading: Consent for provision of certain examinations and services; demonstration of living apart from parents or legal guardian.

content.p: Except as otherwise provided inNRS 450B.525, a minor may give consent for an examination or the services provided in subsection 3 for himself or herself or for his or her child, if the minor: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Demonstrates in accordance with subsection 2 that he or she is living apart from his or her parents or legal guardian, with or without the consent of the parent, parents or legal guardian; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Is married or has been married; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Is a parent or has borne a child; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Is, in the judgment of a provider of health care, in danger of suffering a serious health hazard if health care services are not provided. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A minor may demonstrate that he or she is living apart from his or her parents or legal guardian pursuant to paragraph

of subsection 1 by providing to the person from whom an examination or services are requested documentary proof that he or she is living apart from his or her parents or legal guardian. Such documentary proof may include, without limitation: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A written statement affirming that the minor is living separately from his or her parents or legal guardian signed by: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A director of a governmental agency or nonprofit organization that provides services to persons who are experiencing homelessness or the designee of the director of such an agency or organization; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A school social worker, a school counselor or a person designated as a local educational agency liaison for homeless children and youths pursuant to 42 U.S.C. ï¿½ 11432
(J)(ii); or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Documentation that the minor has been placed in protective custody; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A copy of a decree of emancipation or proof that a petition for such a decree has been filed. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Except as otherwise provided in subsection 5 andNRS 449A.551and450B.525, the consent of the parent or parents or the legal guardian of a minor is not necessary for a local or state health officer, board of health, licensed provider of health care or public or private hospital to examine or provide physical, behavioral, dental or mental health services for any minor, included within the provisions of subsection 1, who understands the nature and purpose of the proposed examination or services and the probable outcome, and voluntarily requests the proposed examination or services. The consent of the minor to examination or services pursuant to this subsection is not subject to disaffirmance because of minority. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A person who provides an examination or services to a minor pursuant to subsection 3 shall, before initiating the examination or services, make prudent and reasonable efforts to obtain the consent of the minor to communicate with his or her parent, parents or legal guardian, and shall make a note of such efforts in the record of the minorï¿½s care. If the person believes that such efforts would jeopardize the examination or services necessary to the minorï¿½s life or necessary to avoid a serious and immediate threat to the minorï¿½s health, the person may omit such efforts and note the reasons for the omission in the record. The person shall not delay or deny the examination or services because the minor refuses to consent to communication with his or her parent, parents or legal guardian. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A minor may not consent to his or her sterilization. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

In the absence of professional negligence, no person providing an examination or services pursuant to subsection 3 is subject to civil or criminal liability for providing that examination or those services. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The parent, parents, legal guardian or custodian of a minor who receives an examination or services pursuant to subsection 3 are not liable for the payment for that examination or those services unless the parent, parents, legal guardian or custodian has consented to the examination or services. The provisions of this subsection do not relieve a parent, parents, legal guardian or custodian from liability for payment for emergency services provided to a minor pursuant toNRS 129.040. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Custodianï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 432B.060. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Professional negligenceï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 41A.015. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Provider of health careï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 629.031.

section.heading: When person standing in loco parentis may give consent for minorï¿½s emergency hospitalization or medical attention.

content.p: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, in cases of emergency in which a minor is in need of immediate hospitalization, medical attention or surgery and, after reasonable efforts made under the circumstances, the parents of such minor cannot be located for the purpose of consenting thereto, consent for such emergency attention may be given by any person standing in loco parentis to such minor.

section.heading: Minor authorized to give express consent for, or deemed to consent to, treatment of substance use disorders or related illnesses under certain circumstances.

content.p: Except as otherwise provided inNRS 449A.551and450B.525, any minor who is under the influence of, or suspected of being under the influence of, a controlled substance: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
May give express consent; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If unable to give express consent, shall be deemed to consent, ï¿½to the furnishing of hospital, medical, surgical or other care for the treatment of substance use disorders or related illnesses by any public or private hospital, medical facility, facility for the dependent or any licensed physician, and the consent of the minor is not subject to disaffirmance because of minority. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Immunity from civil or criminal liability extends to any physician or other person rendering care or treatment pursuant to subsection 1, in the absence of negligent diagnosis, care or treatment. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The consent of the parent, parents or legal guardian of the minor is not necessary to authorize such care, but any physician who treats a minor pursuant to this section shall make every reasonable effort to report the fact of treatment to the parent, parents or legal guardian within a reasonable time after treatment.

section.heading: Minor authorized to give express consent for certain services relating to sexually transmitted diseases and contraceptive drugs or devices.

content.p: A local or state health officer, licensed physician, physician assistant, registered nurse or clinic to conduct an examination for or treat, or both, any sexually transmitted disease. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A local or state health officer, licensed physician, physician assistant, registered nurse, pharmacist or clinic to: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Provide services related to the prevention of sexually transmitted diseases, including, without limitation, the services described inNRS 639.28085; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Issue a prescription for, the dispensing of or the administration of a contraceptive drug or device.

section.heading: Minor may petition juvenile court for decree of emancipation; reference to master.

content.p: Any minor who is at least 16 years of age, who is married or living apart from his or her parents or legal guardian, and who is a resident of the county, may petition the juvenile court of that county for a decree of emancipation. The district court may refer the petition to a master appointed pursuant to title 5 of NRS orchapter 432Bof NRS.
A petition filed pursuant toNRS 129.080must be in writing, verified by the petitioner and set forth: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The name, age and address of the minor; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If no parent or guardian can be found, the name and address of the childï¿½s nearest known relative residing within this state; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
That the minor willingly lives apart from his or her parents or legal guardian with the consent or acquiescence of his or her parents or legal guardian; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
That the source of the minorï¿½s income is not derived from any activity declared to be a crime by the laws of this state or the United States; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
That the minor is attending school or has been excused from enrolling in and attending school pursuant toNRS 392.040to392.125, inclusive. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If any of the facts required by subsection 1 are not known, the petition must so state. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
For filing the petition, the clerk of the district court shall charge the fees prescribed by law for the commencement of civil actions or proceedings generally.

content.p: After a petition has been filed, unless the person to be served voluntarily appears and consents to the hearing, the court shall direct the clerk to issue a notice, reciting briefly the substance of the petition, stating the time and date set for the hearing of the petition, and requiring the person served with the notice to appear before the court at the hearing if the person desires to oppose the petition. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

section.heading: Persons to be served with notice; manner of service; hearing on petition.

content.p: A copy of the notice issued pursuant toNRS 129.100, together with a copy of the petition, must be served upon: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The parents or legal guardian of the minor or, if the parents or legal guardian cannot be found, the nearest known relative of the minor residing within this State, if any; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The legal custodian of the minor, if any; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The appropriate probation officer or parole officer for his or her review and recommendation if the minor is subject to the jurisdiction of the court pursuant to title 5 of NRS; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The district attorney of the county in which the matter is to be heard. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Service of the notice and petition may be made in any manner permitted by the Nevada Rules of Civil Procedure for the service of a summons and complaint. Return of service must be made as provided by that rule. Evidence must be presented to the court if addresses of those required to be served are unknown or for any other reason notice cannot be given. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The court shall hold a hearing on all petitions filed pursuant toNRS 129.080to129.140, inclusive.

section.heading: Hearing: Duties and powers of court; considerations in grant or denial of petition.

content.p: At the time stated in the notice, or at the earliest time thereafter to which the hearing may be postponed, the court shall proceed to hear the petition. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
At the hearing of the petition, the court shall address the petitioner personally and advise the petitioner of the consequences of emancipation, as described inNRS 129.130. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The court may request copies of records in the custody of the school district, the probation office, the Division of Child and Family Services of the Department of Health and Human Services or any other public or private agency to assist in making its determination. The court may further request a recommendation from the probation officer, the Division of Child and Family Services or any other public or private agency that may have communicated with the minor regarding the petition. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The grant or denial of the petition is a matter within the discretion of the court. In making its determination, the court shall consider: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Whether the minor is sufficiently mature and knowledgeable to manage his or her affairs without the guidance of the minorï¿½s parents or guardian; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Whether emancipation is in the best interest of the minor.

section.heading: Decree of emancipation: Effect; petition to void decree.

content.p: If the court determines that the petition should be granted, it shall enter a decree of emancipation. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A decree so entered is conclusive and binding. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Such a decree emancipates the minor for all purposes and removes the disability of minority of the minor insofar as that disability may affect: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The enrolling in any school or college; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The establishment of the minorï¿½s own residence. ï¿½For these purposes, the minor shall be considered in law as an adult, and any obligation the minor incurs is enforceable by and against the minor without regard to his or her minority. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Unless otherwise provided by the decree, the obligation of support otherwise owed a minor by his or her parent or guardian is terminated by the entry of the decree. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Except as otherwise provided in this section, a decree of emancipation does not affect the status of the minor for any purpose, including the applicability of any provision of law which: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Governs matters relating to referrals for delinquent acts or violations ofNRS 392.040to392.125, inclusive, unless the minor has been certified for trial as an adult pursuant to title 5 of NRS; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Imposes penalties or regulates conduct according to the age of any person. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A petition may be filed by any person or by any public agency to void a decree of emancipation on the following grounds: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The minor has become indigent and has insufficient means of support; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The decree of emancipation was obtained by fraud, misrepresentation or the withholding of material information. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The voiding of any decree of emancipation must not alter any contractual obligations or rights or any property rights or interests which arose during the period that the decree was in effect.
The method of emancipation of a minor provided for inNRS 129.080to129.130, inclusive, is in addition to and not in substitution of, any other method of emancipation provided by statute or common law.
